CListViewControl

A ListView control.  Additionally to its features present in AHK it can use sorting-independent indexing for synchronizing its fields with an array.

This control extends CControl.  All basic properties and functions are implemented and documented in this class.

Summary

Functions
ModifyColModifies a column.

CheckedIndexContains the index of the (first) checked row.
CheckedIndicesContains all indices of the checked rows.
FocusedItemContains the focused row.
FocusedIndexContains the index of the focused row.

ReportSet to true to use the Report view mode.

IconSmallSet to true to use the IconSmall view mode.
TileSet to true to use the Tile view mode.

IndependentSortingThis setting is off by default.

Introduction1) Use an event handler.

DoubleRightClick(RowItem)Invoked when the user double-right-clicked on the control.

Marquee()Invoked when the mouse gets moved over the control.

ItemDefocused(RowItem)Invoked when a row loses the focus.
FocusedChanged(RowItem)Invoked when the row focus has changed.
ItemChecked(RowItem)Invoked when the user checks a row.
ItemUnchecked(RowItem)Invoked when the user unchecks a row.
CheckedChanged(RowItem)Invoked when the checked row(s) has/have changed.

Functions

ModifyCol

ModifyCol(Params*)

Modifies a column.  All parameters are optional, see AHK help on LV_ModifyCol for details.

Parameters

ColumnNumberThe number of the column to modify, one-based
OptionsThe new width.  See AHK documentation.
ColumnTitleThe new column title.

InsertCol

InsertCol(Params*)

Inserts a column.  See AHK help on LV_InsertCol for details.

Parameters

ColumnNumberThe position of the new column
OptionsThe new width.  See AHK documentation.
ColumnTitleThe new column title.

DeleteCol

DeleteCol(ColumnNumber)

Deletes a column.  See AHK help on LV_DeleteCol for details.

Properties

Items

An array of all ListView rows.  See CListViewControl.CItems.

SelectedItem

Contains the (first) selected row.

SelectedItems

Contains all selected rows.

SelectedIndex

Contains the index of the (first) selected row.

SelectedIndices

Contains all indices of the selected rows.

CheckedItem

Contains the (first) checked row.

CheckedItems

Contains all checked rows.

CheckedIndex

Contains the index of the (first) checked row.

CheckedIndices

Contains all indices of the checked rows.

FocusedItem

Contains the focused row.

FocusedIndex

Contains the index of the focused row.

List

Set to true to use the List view mode.

Report

Set to true to use the Report view mode.

Icon

Set to true to use the Icon view mode.

IconSmall

Set to true to use the IconSmall view mode.

Tile

Set to true to use the Tile view mode.

LargeIcons

True if this control should display large icons.  Only used in List and Report view modes.

IndependentSorting

This setting is off by default.  In this case, indexing the rows behaves like AHK ListViews usually do.  If it is enabled however, the row indexing will be independent of the current sorting.  That means that the first row can actually be displayed as the second, third,... or last row on the GUI.  This feature is very useful if you need to synchronize an array with the data in the ListView because the index of the array can then be directly mapped to the ListView row index.  This would not be possible if this option was off and the ListView gets sorted differently.

CListViewControl.CItems

An array of all ListView rows.

Options,

Modify(RowNumberOrItem,
Options,
Fields*)

Modifies a row.

Parameters

RowNumberOrItemIndex of the row or the item which should be modified.
OptionsOptions for the modified row.  See AHK documentation on LV_Modify().
FieldsAny additional parameters are used as cell text.

Clear

Clear()

Clears the ListView by deleting all rows.

Delete

Delete(RowNumberOrItem)

Deletes a row.

Parameters

RowNumberOrItemIndex of the row which should be deleted or a CRow object.

Properties

1,2,3,4,...

Rows can be accessed by their index, e.g. this.ListView.Items[1][2] accesses the text of the first row and second column.

Count

The number of rows.

CListViewControl.CItems.CRow

A single row of a ListView control.  CRow uses the unsorted row numbers internally, but it can switch to sorted row numbers depending on the setting of the ListView.

Functions

AddControl

AddControl(type,  
Name,  
Options,  
Text,  
UseEnabledState =  0)

Adds a control to this item that will be visible/enabled only when this item is selected.  The parameters correspond to the Add() function of CGUI.

Parameters

TypeThe type of the control.
NameThe name of the control.
OptionsOptions used for creating the control.
TextThe text of the control.
UseEnabledStateIf true, the control will be enabled/disabled instead of visible/hidden.

MaxIndex

MaxIndex()

Returns the number of columns.

SetIcon

SetIcon(Filename,  
IconNumberOrTransparencyColor =  1)

Sets the icon of a ListView row

Parameters

FilenameThe filename of the file containing the icon or a hBitmap.
IconNumberOrTransparencyColorThe icon number or the transparency color if the used file has no transparency support.

Modify

Modify(Options,
Fields*)

Modifies a row.

Parameters

OptionsOptions for the modified row.  See AHK documentation on LV_Modify().
FieldsAny additional parameters are used as cell text.

Properties

1,2,3,4,...

Columns can be accessed by their index, e.g. this.ListView.Items[1][2] accesses the text of the first row and second column.

Text

The text of the first column of this row.

Index

The index of this row.  It obeys the setting of IndependentSorting.

Count

The number of columns.

Checked

True if the row is checked.

Selected

True if the row is selected.

Focused

True if the row is foucsed.

Icon

The filename of the file containing the icon for the current row.

IconNumber

The number of the icon in a multi-icon file.

Events

Introduction

There are currently 3 methods to handle control events

1) Use an event handler.  Simply use control.EventName.Handler := “HandlingFunction” Instead of “HandlingFunction” it is also possible to pass a function reference or a Delegate: control.EventName.Handler := new Delegate(Object, “HandlingFunction”) If this method is used, the first parameter will contain the control object that sent this event.

2) Create a function with this naming scheme in your window class: ControlName_EventName(params)

3) Instead of using ControlName_EventName() you may also call CControl.RegisterEvent on a control instance to register a different event function name.  This method is deprecated since event handlers are more flexible.

The parameters depend on the event and there may not be params at all in some cases.

Click(RowItem)

Invoked when the user clicked on the control.

DoubleClick(RowItem)

Invoked when the user double-clicked on the control.

RightClick(RowItem)

Invoked when the user right-clicked on the control.

DoubleRightClick(RowItem)

Invoked when the user double-right-clicked on the control.

Invoked when the control loses the focus.

Marquee()

ScrollingStart()
